intro: Daucus cuminifolius, commonly known as the cuminleaf cowpea, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that resemble those of the cumin plant, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in temperate climates. Daucus cuminifolius is often found growing in dry, rocky soils and is sometimes cultivated for its edible leaves and seeds.
